Work is already underway on a number of projects, in areas such as district heating and an electric vehicle charging network, which secured funding under the first round of the scheme

The aim of the Climate Action Fund is to kick start innovative projects in the enormous transition which we have to make. That transition presents opportunities to be seized as well as patterns to be changed. This demands that we be both agile and fair as we manage the challenges

We will publish legislation today which will establish the €500m Climate Action Plan on a statutory basis. This will mean the surplus funds from the NORA levy, which is a levy on the oil industry, can now be used to fund climate action

We are now consulting on the development of an offshore energy grid. Vital step to developing a new offshore wind sector which will be important for climate action and for jobs. Our offshore plan would provide power for 3 million homes https://t.co/zsruTbr5iK

Renewable electricity brought from 27% in 2016 to 37% now. We’re well on the way to hitting 70% renewable electricity by 2030. There’ll be a big focus on building a new offshore wind sector to deliver our ambition.

I’d like to thank Kieran for his work to date. He has engaged with all those affected to come up with a comprehensive set of recommendations which will provide the essential elements of a Just Transition for workers and Midlands communities
We’ve opened the first call for proposals under the €11m Just Transition Fund as part of our initial response. A full implementation plan will be published shortly

The government approved and published the first progress report from the Just Transition Commissioner Kieran Mulvey today. It is vital that we secure sustainable employment opportunities for the Midlands

As we consider our future recovery, we must ensure that climate resilience is built in and that we leverage Ireland’s natural assets and invest in our renewable capacity, particularly offshore wind.

These results show that it is possible to break the link between economic progress and carbon emissions. Last year, the economy grew by 6% but our electricity and major industrial emissions fell by 8.7%. It is welcome progress, but we must do more https://t.co/C3bkvVKarI
Sean is an exceptional broadcaster who asks the hard questions but also lets you answer! The very best of luck with your retirement @TodaySOR
I have joined 13 colleague Ministers across the EU in calling for the European Green Deal to be central to a resilient jobs and economic recovery. Details are published here: https://t.co/nXVg5bry2l.
Service providers will work with Comreg in the event of complaints raised to Comreg by consumers, who consider they are not being treated in accordance with these commitments

To ensure customers remain connected in these difficult times, service providers will engage with any customer that contacts them who is in financial difficulty as a result of Covid-19 and has difficulty paying their bills to agree the best way of keeping them connected
Access to healthcare and educational resource websites identified by the Government will be zero-rated for all customers where technically feasible
Service providers may implement appropriate permitted traffic management measures to avoid network congestion
Fair usage policies will not be automatically applied to unlimited fixed and mobile data packages

Any customer who does not have fixed broadband and who relies solely on mobile access to the internet will have the opportunity to avail of affordable unlimited mobile data access/package from their service provider

Telecoms providers have agreed to a number of Covid-19 commitments: - any fixed broadband customers who do not have unlimited usage already as standard will be given the opportunity, if they require, to upgrade their package (which may be on a temporary basis)

Now more than ever it is so important to stay in touch at a distance. Telecoms providers including BT Ireland, Eir, Pure Telecoms, Sky Ireland, Tesco Mobile Ireland, Three Ireland, Virgin Media & Vodafone have agreed with my Dept to increase supports to help people stay in touch

I’ve published Cyber Security Guidance on Working from Home. Now more than ever, people are relying on technology to stay connected. This exposes you to risks which may be unfamiliar. This advise explains how you can protect yourself from hacking and fraud https://t.co/aRwnc4WDij

@Postvox is a trusted & reliable source of communication in our communities & they have stepped up to deliver more services for us in our time of need. I would like to commend our postmen & women who have very generously offered to check in on older & vulnerable people https://t.co/pbR8U3p9DK

I have also asked the BAI to conduct an urgent assessment of the financial situation of local radio as a result of the Covid- 19 Pandemic.

To ensure that local radio stations can continue to play a role in serving local communities, I have requested the Broadcasting Authority of Ireland to waive the broadcasting levy for the first six months of the year. This action will save local radio stations almost €1m.

I recognise the importance of local radio stations to their communities as a trusted source of information on the Covid -19 Pandemic. They play a crucial role, especially in broadcasting community specific information across the country (cont)

@CAugustenborg @FineGael Hi Cara, Carbon tax will raise €6bn. Budget 2020 allocated the initial funding to a range of initiatives full detail in link below (notes for editor). Furthermore, we have committed €2bn to retrofitting & €600m for cycling over the next decade (1/2)
Fine Gael outlining Just Transition proposals https://t.co/OM8MYl9pmX

We have published a detailed Climate Action Plan that will deliver huge change. From my experience with the Action Plan for Jobs, change is delivered action by action, reform by reform. This same approach will deliver real climate action https://t.co/GpK74lqq5t
Our major home upgrade programme will start with social housing in the Midlands

We are also announcing that we will invest €360 million to support the transition away from peat burning in the Midlands over the next five years. It will support bog restoration, community development and home upgrades
A new area based model for upgrading homes will ensure we upgrade 500,000 homes making them warmer and more energy efficient
Today I’m announcing that we will ring fence one third of the carbon fund for housing upgrades. That’ll bring total investment in retrofitting to almost €6 billion.
We are determined to deliver the Climate Action Plan, cut our reliance on fossil fuels, and deliver warmer homes, cleaner air and a more sustainable economy https://t.co/lAXmfb98XX
